data.sampled: No, 1 pound of cast iron is not heavier than 3 pounds of spider silk. In fact, 3 pounds of spider silk is much lighter than 1 pound of cast iron. According to a study conducted by the University of Wyoming, the density of cast iron is approximately 7.87 grams per cubic centimeter, while the density of spider silk is only 1.3 grams per cubic centimeter. Therefore, a pound of cast iron would be much denser and heavier than 3 pounds of spider silk.
